title: [JIT] Don't support dynamic args in torch.chunk
body_html:
Currently chunk argument (num_chunks) must be a constant, but in some case we want to support it as python native:

input.chunk(input.chunk(input.size(1)), dim=1)

Here is the failure

======================================================================
ERROR: test_time_sequence_prediction (__main__.TestEndToEndHybridFrontendModels)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_jit.py", line 4406, in test_time_sequence_prediction
    self.checkTrace(Sequence(), (torch.rand(97, 999),), verbose=True)
  File "/Users/wanchaol/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 558, in init_then_register
    self._create_methods(asts, rcbs)
RuntimeError:
argument 'chunks' must be a constant:
body_text:
Currently chunk argument (num_chunks) must be a constant, but in some case we want to support it as python native:
input.chunk(input.chunk(input.size(1)), dim=1)

Here is the failure
======================================================================

Traceback (most recent call last):

body:
Currently chunk argument (num_chunks) must be a constant, but in some case we want to support it as python native:

```
input.chunk(input.chunk(input.size(1)), dim=1)
```

Here is the failure

```
======================================================================
ERROR: test_time_sequence_prediction (__main__.TestEndToEndHybridFrontendModels)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_jit.py", line 4406, in test_time_sequence_prediction
    self.checkTrace(Sequence(), (torch.rand(97, 999),), verbose=True)
  File "/Users/wanchaol/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 558, in init_then_register
    self._create_methods(asts, rcbs)
RuntimeError:
argument 'chunks' must be a constant:
```
